argumentText:
ARGUMENT
x y

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | #P_eluni2 | |- ( x e. U. ( topGen ` B ) <-> E. y e. ( topGen ` B ) x e. y ) |
| 2 |  | #P_eltg | |- ( B e. V -> ( y e. ( topGen ` B ) <-> y C_ U. ( B i^i ~P y ) ) ) |
| 3 |  | #P_inss1 | |- ( B i^i ~P y ) C_ B |
| 4 | 3 | #P_unissi | |- U. ( B i^i ~P y ) C_ U. B |
| 5 |  | #P_sstr | |- ( ( y C_ U. ( B i^i ~P y ) /\ U. ( B i^i ~P y ) C_ U. B ) -> y C_ U. B ) |
| 6 | 4, 5 | #P_mpan2 | |- ( y C_ U. ( B i^i ~P y ) -> y C_ U. B ) |
| 7 | 6 | #P_sseld | |- ( y C_ U. ( B i^i ~P y ) -> ( x e. y -> x e. U. B ) ) |
| 8 | 2, 7 | #P_syl6bi | |- ( B e. V -> ( y e. ( topGen ` B ) -> ( x e. y -> x e. U. B ) ) ) |
| 9 | 8 | #P_rexlimdv | |- ( B e. V -> ( E. y e. ( topGen ` B ) x e. y -> x e. U. B ) ) |
| 10 | 1, 9 | #P_syl5bi | |- ( B e. V -> ( x e. U. ( topGen ` B ) -> x e. U. B ) ) |
| 11 |  | #P_bastg | |- ( B e. V -> B C_ ( topGen ` B ) ) |
| 12 | 11 | #P_unissd | |- ( B e. V -> U. B C_ U. ( topGen ` B ) ) |
| 13 | 12 | #P_sseld | |- ( B e. V -> ( x e. U. B -> x e. U. ( topGen ` B ) ) ) |
| 14 | 10, 13 | #P_impbid | |- ( B e. V -> ( x e. U. ( topGen ` B ) <-> x e. U. B ) ) |
| 15 | 14 | #P_eqrdv | |- ( B e. V -> U. ( topGen ` B ) = U. B ) |
\
 The topology generated by a basis ` B ` is a topology on ` U. B ` . Importantly, this theorem means that we don't have to specify separately the base set for the topological space generated by a basis.  In other words, any member of the class ` TopBases ` completely specifies the basis it corresponds to.  (Contributed by NM, 16-Jul-2006.)  Obsolete version of ~ unitg as of 30--Mar-2020.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
